verses.name: Proverbs 7:1
verses.text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:2
verses.text: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:3
verses.text: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:4
verses.text: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

verses.name: Proverbs 7:5
verses.text: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:6
verses.text: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

verses.name: Proverbs 7:7
verses.text: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

verses.name: Proverbs 7:8
verses.text: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

verses.name: Proverbs 7:9
verses.text: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

verses.name: Proverbs 7:10
verses.text: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:11
verses.text: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

verses.name: Proverbs 7:12
verses.text: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

verses.name: Proverbs 7:13
verses.text: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

verses.name: Proverbs 7:14
verses.text: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:15
verses.text: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:16
verses.text: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:17
verses.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:18
verses.text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:19
verses.text: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

verses.name: Proverbs 7:20
verses.text: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:21
verses.text: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:22
verses.text: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

verses.name: Proverbs 7:23
verses.text: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:24
verses.text: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:25
verses.text: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:26
verses.text: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.

verses.name: Proverbs 7:27
verses.text: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
